content:
Here is the cleaned up text:

Verify Entitlements

Each entitlement in Salesforce is associated with a specific account. Verify that a customer is entitled to customer support before you create or update a case or work order.

Available in: Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions with the Service Cloud

To view entitlements:
	* Read on entitlements
	* Read on accounts, contacts, assets, and service contracts
	* Verify entitlements on related lists

Steps to verify:

1. Whether at least one contact on a specific account is entitled to support: View the account detail page and confirm that the entitlement is on the Entitlements related list.
2. Whether a specific contact is entitled to support: View the contact detail page and confirm that the entitlement is on the Entitlements related list.
3. Whether specific assets (purchased products) are entitled to support: Locate the asset from a related list or an assets list view on the Products tab, click the asset name, and confirm that the entitlement is on the Entitlements related list.
4. Whether the customer is charged for a new work order: Check the value in Remaining Work Orders on the Entitlements details page.
5. Whether a service contract includes a specific entitlement: Click the Service Contracts tab, click the service contract name, and confirm that the entitlement in question is on the Entitlements related list.

After you verify an entitlement, click New Case on the entitlementâ€™s detail page to create a case associated with the entitlement.

SEE ALSO
Guidelines for Working with Entitlements
title: Verifying Customer Entitlements in Salesforce
